events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and filed the initial claim for damages.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the initial incident description.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to manage the vehicle accident claim for the customer.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and began processing.
Request sent to the customer for vehicle repair estimates, police report, and photos of the accident.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police report and detailed repair cost estimates.
Investigation into the accident details started to verify claim validity and assess vehicle damages.
Investigation concluded confirming accident circumstances and validating customerâ€™s damage claims.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering repair costs and related expenses.
Customer provided feedback on the settlement offer and expressed willingness to proceed with payment.
The claim was approved officially by management after reviewing all documents and customer feedback.
Payment was issued promptly for vehicle repairs as per the agreed settlement terms.
The auto accident claim was closed successfully after payment confirmation and customer satisfaction.
All documents and correspondence related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference.
